poem:
Title: "The Swell of Financial Tides"

The wind drafts policies on rooftops,
Scribbling in sleet and the ink of rain,
Illegible handwriting of the hurricane.
As premiums rise like floodwater,
Our spared goods afloat in economic sway,
We are insured in a world unsure,
The uncertain climate, an adding machine,
Tabulating the cost of sun, surge, and air,
Within our homes— these vaults of vulnerable care.
